tasks.task: Identify the location of sprinkler valves and mark with colored flags.
subtasks: Determine the area for each valve's zone.
Use different colored flags to denote each zone's path.
Mark the exact spots where trenches need to be dug using marking spray.

tasks.task: Dig trenches for the main water line.
subtasks: Position the main water line near the water meter for maximum volume and pressure.
Split off the main line into the irrigation line using a ball valve.
Install a valve box over the ball valve for easy future access.
Remove obstacles (roots, sidewalk) as needed to accommodate the water line and pipes.

tasks.task: Install the backflow prevention device.
subtasks: Understand local requirements for backflow prevention (anti-siphon or PVB).
Choose and install the appropriate backflow prevention device (e.g., pressure vacuum breaker).

tasks.task: Connect irrigation pipes and manifold.
subtasks: Attach schedule 40 PVC pipes between the main line and valves.
Utilize premium manifold kits for easier valve replacement and faster installation.
Use Class 200 pipe for lower pressure areas to save cost and effort.

tasks.task: Bore through driveways or concrete surfaces.
subtasks: Use a water-powered boring kit to create a channel for pipes under concrete/driveways.
Ensure proper connection of pipes after boring.

tasks.task: Install flexible swing joints for sprinkler heads.
subtasks: Protect against damage from heavy objects or ground changes by using flexible joints.

tasks.task: Ensure electrical safety and wire protection.
subtasks: Use direct burial wire for underground connections without conduit.
Connect wires to valves using silicone-filled waterproof connectors.
Coil buried wires to prevent kinks and damage.
Route wiring through PVC conduit to the controller inside the garage.

tasks.task: Configure controller and rain sensor.
subtasks: Connect rain sensor and wires to the smart controller.
Strip wires and test each for correct zone assignment using a powered terminal.
Program controller settings to manage different zones and override features (e.g., yard vs. flower bed).

tasks.task: Install sprinkler heads and adjust arcs.
subtasks: Select sprinkler heads (RVans, HE Vans) appropriate for coverage distance and nozzles.
Position sprinkler heads according to the planned zones (yard, flower beds).
Adjust the spray patterns of sprinklers to cover the designated areas without overlap.
Verify proper height and arc coverage for each sprinkler head.

tasks.task: Final checks and testing.
subtasks: Flush the backflow preventer and open test cocks.
Test each zone to ensure proper functionality and adjust as needed.
Verify the system's performance under normal water flow and evaluate water usage efficiency (e.g., 33% reduction with HE Van nozzles).
Encourage viewers to contact customer service for help and subscribe to the channel for more tips.
